publicwhip.spmotion: S3M-5327 Shipweld 2009 (lodged on 1 December 2009) Jamie Hepburn*
S3M-5327 Shipweld 2009 (lodged on 1 December 2009) Sarah Boyack*

S3M-5327 John Park: Shipweld 2009—That the Parliament congratulates the Rosyth-based Babcock apprentices, Ryan Rice and Liam McBride, on winning the 2009 Shipweld best yard competition held at Barrow on 12 November 2009; notes that the competition featured yards from across the United Kingdom, including Portsmouth, the Clyde and Barrow; further notes that entrants faced a series of craft challenges designed to test key welding requirements for the manufacture of surface and subsurface vessels; recognises the skills and techniques demonstrated by all the apprentice welders in the competition; welcomes the Shipweld competition’s contribution to promoting skills development and safe working practices, and looks forward to further success for Scottish apprentices in future competitions. Supported by: Jamie Hepburn, Sarah Boyack, Elizabeth Smith*, Nanette Milne*, Mary Mulligan*, David Stewart*, Stuart McMillan*, Kenneth Gibson*, George Foulkes*, Bill Wilson*, Cathy Jamieson*, Des McNulty*, Aileen Campbell*, Bill Kidd*, James Kelly*, David Whitton*
S3M-5327 Shipweld 2009 (lodged on 1 December 2009) Trish Godman*, Dr Richard Simpson*, Jackie Baillie*, Michael McMahon*, Jim Tolson*
S3M-5327 Shipweld 2009 (lodged on 1 December 2009) Gil Paterson*, Karen Whitefield*
S3M-5327 Shipweld 2009 (lodged on 1 December 2009) Hugh Henry*
S3M-5327 Shipweld 2009 (lodged on 1 December 2009) Rhona Brankin*
